This is important because the first part of the code (the loops over colors) might not have considered overlapping segments, but this sweep line approach ensures that any overlapping segments (of different colors) get their distance set to zero.

So combining both parts:

The first part (the loops over colors) computes the minimal distance from the current segment to the nearest non-overlapping segments of different colors, but only if there are no overlapping segments. The second part (sweep line) ensures that if there is any overlapping segment of different color, the distance is zero.

Therefore, the code's approach is:

- For each segment, compute the minimal distance to the closest non-overlapping segments of different colors (using the L and R sets after removing same color).

- Then, using the sweep line, check if there are any overlapping segments of different colors. If yes, set the distance to zero.

This way, the minimal distance is the minimum between the computed distance and zero (if overlapping exists).
